jobs.title: Lead Technical Project Manager | B2B | SaaS
jobs.description:
ABOUT DISTRIBUTED 🚀

We're building the world's Elastic Workforce - reinventing work and re-telling its story.

We help businesses deliver technical projects better than ever before through our platform and on-demand Elastic Teams.

Customers use our platform to scope any technical project and are then paired with a fully managed Elastic Team to deliver.

Our Elastic Teams are built from the world's best permanent freelancers who have all passed Distributed's rigorous on-boarding tests.  

We have recently secured £3m in seed funding and are now hiring a number of exciting roles for exceptional growth ahead. 

Want to know more? read: https://distributed.co/about


ABOUT THE ROLE

As a Lead Technical Project Manager, you must have a proven track record of leading Technical Development projects, managing and improving technical project teams, excellent communication skills, and a deep understanding of web, mobile products, and the strategies around them.

We’re looking for a team leader that can:

• Improve and execute upon our project delivery strategy
• Manage multiple stakeholder relationships simultaneously
• Scope and deliver technical development projects
• write clean, simple project documentation
• Create repeatable, predictable project processes

We’re looking for a team leader that enjoys:

• Being part of a fast-growth platform company
• Contributing to our cultural and strategic makeup
• Helping us improve our processes and systems
• Winning as part of a team

An equity, bonus, and commission package will included as part of your compensation package of this role.

You'll be teaming up with scientists, engineers, product managers, and salespeople from a diverse set of backgrounds who are challenging every assumption about how businesses deliver digital work.

We’re looking forward to hearing from you.

Previous experience is essential within this role, however if you're excited about working with us or even just want to find out more about what we're doing, please get in touch, we're more than happy to talk about how we’re reshaping the way businesses work.

jobs.title: Technical Lead | Software development teams
jobs.description:
ABOUT DISTRIBUTED 🚀

We're building the world's Elastic Workforce - reinventing work and re-telling its story.

We help businesses deliver technical projects better than ever before through our platform and on-demand Elastic Teams.

Customers use our platform to scope any technical project and are then paired with a fully managed Elastic Team to deliver.

Our Elastic Teams are built from the world's best permanent freelancers who have all passed Distributed's rigorous on-boarding tests.  

We have recently secured £3m in seed funding and are now hiring a number of exciting roles for exceptional growth ahead. 

Want to know more? read: https://distributed.co/about

TECHNICAL LEAD ROLE

We are looking for an exceptional Technical Lead to support and coach our high-performing engineers and to help shape and drive both technical product decisions and engineering practices.

You will be joining the company at an exciting stage as our Elastic Team and deliveries completed through the platform continue to rapidly grow. Our Elastic Teams have delivered products for everyone, from massive financial organisations to bleeding edge tech startups building their first products. At Distributed, you will get to work on it all.

RESPONSIBILITIES

- Manage and motivate a growing team of fully distributed remote engineers

- Ensuring technical excellence by setting a high bar for our engineering practices and delivery, developing tools, processes, and documentation to scale our platform and team

- Leading technical decisions on behalf of our team and customers that will shape the future of the Distributed platform

- Mentoring using your interpersonal skills to help the engineering team work through technical challenges. You’ll help them improve and develop over time to meet their personal career objectives

REQUIREMENTS

- Experience managing the performance and development of high-performing engineers

- An empathetic leadership style and you build strong, effective relationships

- Your previous titles may include Senior Developer, Technical Lead or Engineering Manager

- Get excited about designing and implementing complex web applications

- Knowledge of industry best practices for building scalable and highly reliable SaaS/PaaS applications

BONUS

- Experience in enterprise SaaS

- Experience managing fully remote teams.

COMPENSATION

- Competitive salary (£70,000-£100,000 depending on experience) and equity available

- Employee pension plan

- Private healthcare

- Catered team lunches provided every Friday

- 34 days of holiday a year (26 days + Bank holidays)

- This role is based full time in our London office


WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING AT DISTRIBUTED 😄

We are a high performing team of around 20 people based near Shoreditch. We celebrate our diverse group of talented employees and we pride ourselves on our transparent, collaborative, friendly and respectful culture.

We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, stock options, pension plans and private healthcare. We host regular company socials, weekly catered lunches and the office is full of snacks, coffee and beers on tap.

We value learning and will help you with your personal development in every way we can. The team regularly exchange books, podcasts, recommended readings and we actively support further education. Our mission is to help you succeed and flourish within the company and your career.

jobs.description:

ABOUT THE ROLE 

The Head of Delivery leads the engine room of Distributed, ensuring our Elastic Teams produce excellent outcomes for our customers every time.

The role requires exceptional leadership, experience of building rapidly scaling organisations and confidence working within a technical environment (though strong technical proficiency isn’t necessary).

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
jobs.description:
ABOUT DISTRIBUTED 
We're building the world's Elastic Workforce - reinventing work and re-telling its story.

We help businesses deliver technical projects better than ever before through our platform and on-demand Elastic Teams. Customers use our platform to scope any technical project and be matched with a fully managed Elastic Team to deliver. Our Elastic Teams are a collection of engineers and data scientists from the top tier of remote freelancers around the world.

We have recently secured £3m in seed funding and are now hiring a number of exciting roles for exceptional growth ahead. Want to know more? read: distributed.co/about

SALES DEVELOPMENT REPRESENTATIVE ROLE
As a Sales Development Representative (SDR) at Distributed you will be a primary driver of expanding our business and sharing the value of what we provide to customer prospects. You will qualify the increasing volume of inbound leads while also working with our sales team to actively prospect into named accounts. 

You will join a fast growing sales team with the mission to help our customers and prospects better understand our differentiation and value proposition. This is an incredible opportunity to further develop your sales skills, while helping to accelerate the growth of an innovative company.

RESPONSIBILITIES
- Achieve monthly quotas of leads qualified, meetings set and opportunities created.
- Strategically prospect into key account targets, which includes researching and identifying key contacts, calling and emailing prospects to generate initial interest, and setting meetings with our business development representatives and managers.
- Maintain accurate and current information on prospects and interaction activities in Salesforce.
- Maintain expert knowledge of Distributed products and messaging to effectively and persuasively demonstrate and articulate the value proposition.
- Work closely with the sales team in developing new ways to increase awareness of Distributed and to evolve and improve the lead qualification process.

REQUIREMENTS
- 1+ years of sales development experience (startup experience is a bonus).
- A ‘hunter’ mentality - comfortable prospecting, cold-calling, and following up on incoming leads.
- Confident presentation skills, a comfort level with senior professionals and the communications skills to articulate the Distributed value proposition.
- Highly motivated, driven, and self-starter.
- Outstanding communication and listening skills.
- Ability and willingness to learn, to react to and share lessons learned across the organisation.
• Good time management with strong organisational skills.

COMPENSATION
- Competitive salary (£35,000-£50,000 depending on experience) and equity available.
- Employee pension plan.
- Private healthcare.
- Catered team lunches provided every Friday.
- 36 days of holiday a year (28 days + Bank holidays).

WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING AT DISTRIBUTED 😁
We are a high performing team of around 20 people based near Shoreditch. We celebrate our diverse group of talented employees and we pride ourselves on our transparent, collaborative, friendly and respectful culture.

We value learning and will help you with your personal development in every way we can. The team regularly exchange books, podcasts, recommended readings and we actively support further education. Our mission is to help you succeed and flourish within the company and your career.

BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER ROLE
As a Business Development Manager (BDM) at Distributed you will be a primary driver of expanding our business and bringing in new customers.

You will be deeply researching our prospective customers business objectives to best align our value proposition to their business goals and negotiating and closing deals on behalf of the company and your sales team. 

This is an incredible opportunity to earn exceptional commissions, further develop your sales skills, while helping to accelerate the growth of an exciting tech startup.

RESPONSIBILITIES
- Achieve monthly targets of meetings, opportunities and new deals closed.
- Maintain expert knowledge of Distributed products and messaging to effectively and persuasively demonstrate and articulate the value proposition.
- Create detailed and bespoke proposals. 
- Negotiate deals and long term contracts with prospective customers.
- Maintain accurate and current information on active deals and customer interactions in Salesforce.
- Deeply research prospective customers to understand their business objectives and align Distributed’s value proposition with their business goals.
- Build excellent and long-lasting relationships with our customers. 

REQUIREMENTS
- 3+ years of business development experience (startup experience is a bonus).
- A ‘closer’ mentality - comfortable presenting, nurturing, negotiating and winning deals.
- Confident presentation skills, a comfort level with senior professionals and the communications skills to articulate the Distributed value proposition.
- Highly motivated, driven, and self-starter.
- Outstanding communication and listening skills.
- Ability and willingness to learn, to react to and share lessons learned across the organisation.
- Good time management with strong organisational skills.

COMPENSATION
- Competitive salary (£50,000-£70,000 depending on experience) and equity available.
- Employee pension plan.
- Private healthcare.
- Catered team lunches provided every Friday.
- 36 days of holiday a year (28 days + Bank holidays).

WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING AT DISTRIBUTED 😁
We are a high performing team of around 20 people based near Shoreditch. We celebrate our diverse group of talented employees and we pride ourselves on our transparent, collaborative, friendly and respectful culture.

We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, stock options, pension plans and private healthcare. We host regular company socials, weekly catered lunches and the office is full of snacks, coffee and beers on tap.

We value learning and will help you with your personal development in every way we can. The team regularly exchange books, podcasts, recommended readings and we actively support further education. Our mission is to help you succeed and flourish within the company and your career.

Customers use our platform to scope any technical project and are then paired with a fully managed Elastic Team to deliver.

Our Elastic Teams are built from the world's best permanent freelancers who have all passed Distributed's rigorous on-boarding tests.  

We have recently secured £3m in seed funding and are now hiring a number of exciting roles for exceptional growth ahead. 

Want to know more? read: https://distributed.co/about


**ABOUT THE ROLE **

As Distributed’s Head of Product you’ll lead product development across both our service and our software products.

The role requires exceptional product leadership, experience in leading service and software product teams, a growth mindset and the ability to execute at pace. 

Our problem is not finding areas to build product, It’s about deciding where we can have the biggest impact and what we prioritise.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**

• Own the development of our product vision, strategy and roadmap across the whole customer lifecycle

• Ensure that our products continuously and consistently delight our customers

• Design, grow and manage a high performing product team 

• Collaborate with the rest of the management team to ensure the continued success of Distributed

• Advocate for and build awareness of Distributed’s product capabilities through blogs, social media and public appearances

• Maintain and improve upon our company culture


**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS**

• 2 years leading product at a scale-up or technology-first enterprise organisation
• Experience in strengthening customer and partner experiences
• Strong entrepreneurial drive 
• Continual improvement mindset
• Desire to build a best-in-class customer solutions
• Excellent customer and stakeholder management skills
• Proven 


**COMPENSATION**

• Competitive salary (£60,000-£75,000)
• Equity share can be discussed at interview stage
• Employee pension plan
• Private healthcare
• Catered team lunches provided every Friday
• 36 days of holiday a year (26 days + Bank holidays)

We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, stock options, pension plans and private healthcare. We host regular company socials, weekly catered lunches and the office is full of snacks, coffee and beers on tap.

We value learning and will help you with your personal development in every way we can. The team regularly exchange books, podcasts, recommended readings and we actively support further education. Our mission is to help you succeed and flourish within the company and your career.
